title: Japan is as good a place as any to ride out the economic storm
text:
It doesn’t pay to underestimate Japan, as Ireland recently found to its cost in the Rugby World Cup. When the country puts its mind to it, there is not much it cannot achieve.

Having dispatched Samoa on Saturday, an unexpected progression to the latter stages of the tournament it is hosting is now in its own hands.

Taking its place at sport’s’ top table may prove easier than maintaining its ranking in the global economy. The last time Tokyo hosted the Olympics in 1964, the Japanese miracle lay ahead. Now, as it gears up for the 2020 event, its ageing population and deserted countryside can feel like yesterday’s story in an otherwise vibrant region.

Like another small island nation with a difficult...
description: It doesn’t pay to underestimate Japan, as Ireland recently found to its cost in the Rugby World Cup.
